questions.text: A patient undergoing surgery in the prone position is maintained on mechanical ventilation with PEEP. What is the significance of using PEEP in this scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: Prevents alveoli collapse and atelectasis of lung

options.label: C
options.text: Increases venous return and maintains cardiac output

questions.correct_answer: A. Prevents alveoli collapse and atelectasis of lung

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true about eutectic mixture of local anesthetic (EMLA)?

options.label: D
options.text: It is made of Lignocaine and ropivacaine

questions.correct_answer: B. Methohemoglobinemia is a side effect

questions.text: An anesthetist used the airway device shown in the image given below on a patient. Which among the following statements is true regarding the adjunct?

options.label: A
options.text: It can cause damage to the teeth

options.label: B
options.text: It can be used in conscious patients

options.label: D
options.text: It can be safely used in facial trauma cases

questions.correct_answer: B. It can be used in conscious patients

questions.text: In the following condition as shown in the radiograph, which of the following procedures would be difficult to perform?

A COVID-19 patient admitted to the ICU on mechanical ventilation suddenly develops hypoxia. The patient has decreased breath sounds on the left side and increased intrathoracic pressure. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old child presents with drowsiness and refusal to feed. On examination, the child is in a stuporous state. The ECG is shown below. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Defibrillate, check rhythm and then start CPR

options.label: C
options.text: Defibrillate followed by CPR for 2min, and check rhythm

options.label: D
options.text: Stop CPR and do cardioversion at 2 joules/kg

questions.correct_answer: C. Defibrillate followed by CPR for 2min, and check rhythm

questions.text: A patient underwent gastrectomy for gastric adenocarcinoma. Which of the following vitamins needs to be supplemented in this patient?

A 10-year-old child from a southern Indian state, hailing from a poor family, presents with rough and scaly skin. The child’s diet lacks vegetables and fruits. After treatment with linseed oil, Vitamin A, and Vitamin B, the symptoms subsided. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient arrives at the emergency department with intense abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. Laboratory tests reveal serum triglyceride levels exceeding 2000 mg/dl. What deficiency might be contributing to this patient's condition?

After the age of 12, the boy had an intellectual disability. On examination, fingernail abrasions, excessive biting of lips, and increased levels of serum uric acid were observed. What is the likely diagnosis?

A neonate was brought with features of lethargy, and poor oral intake. On examination, a cataract was seen. Urine Benedict’s test was positive but negative for Glucose. What will be the enzyme deficiency in this condition?

A patient diagnosed with a rare homozygous recessive condition presented with ectopia lentis. In the peripheral smear, there was no megaloblastic anemia. Later, he was found to have elevated homocysteine levels in the blood. Which of the following supplementations will help the patient?

You received a message from your friend, a person who recently visited his doctor due to concerns about potential exposure to hazardous materials. He is worried about respiratory issues and other health effects. Serum porphobilinogen levels are decreased. What is the likely diagnosis ?

A 3-year-old child is brought to the OPD with complaints of persistent delayed developmental milestones, and hyperpigmented macular lesions on the body which are more pronounced on exposure to sunlight. What is the error in DNA multiplication?

A patient with a family history of coronary heart disease presented with tendon xanthomas. His lipid profile showed serum LDL to be 280 mg/dL and triglyceride levels was 398 mg/dl. What is the likely defect in this patient?
Which food item among these is the primary source of thiamine in Indians?
A young female comes to the emergency department after ingesting 10 tablets of Phenobarbital. Which of the following components of the ETC is inhibited by this drug?

A child presents to you with bone pain, hepatosplenomegaly, and pancytopenia. A trephine biopsy aspirate shows the following finding. Which of the following is the most likely enzyme deficient in this patient?
Identify the image shown below:
A 14-year-old rape victim is 22 weeks pregnant and she would like to terminate her pregnancy. Which of the following is done under the MTP Act?

options.label: A
options.text: Opinion of 1 doctor is enough upto 24 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Termination allowed between 20-24 weeks only if detrimental to mother’s life

options.label: D
options.text: Can terminate pregnancy upto 24 weeks for sexual assault

questions.correct_answer: D. Can terminate pregnancy upto 24 weeks for sexual assault

questions.text: A ventouse vacuum was placed at the flexion point. What is the correct statement regarding flexion point?

options.label: B
options.text: Midpoint of anterior and posterior fontanelle

questions.text: A primigravida who is a known case of bronchial asthma develops PPH. Which of the following needs to be avoided in this patient?
A patient with a carcinoma cervix lesion showing cervical growth extending to the pelvic side wall along with the presence of hydronephrosis. What is the stage of the tumour?
A 60-year-old female presented with a mass per vagina, as shown in the image. What is the diagnosis?
A woman at 37 weeks of gestation comes to the OPD for an antenatal checkup. She is on warfarin for prosthetic valves. What would be the management of this patient? LMWH-Low molecular weight heparin
An 18-year-old girl with short stature has primary amenorrhea and has not attained puberty yet. Identify the chromosomal defect as shown in the image.
The illustration given below is used for which female genital pathology?
A teenage girl presents with primary amenorrhea, normal breast and pubic hair development with normal uterus & ovaries. What is the karyotype?
A female complaints of dysuria since 4 days associated with pelvic pain and abnormal vaginal discharge. Pap smear image is given below. What is the diagnosis?

A 28-year-old lady with 27 weeks of gestation has multiple congenital malformations in the fetus on radiological investigations. The parents want to terminate the pregnancy for which they went to the MTP board. Who is not a part of the MTP board?
A woman at 30 weeks of gestation presents with pain and redness in the calf region. A diagnosis of DVT is made. Which of the following would you use in the management of the patient?

A G2P1L1 woman with a prior breech delivery had an uneventful LSCS. She was later admitted to the ER due to antepartum hemorrhage and underwent another LSCS, during which she experienced significant blood loss, leading to the need for an obstetric hysterectomy. Based on this information, what is the likely diagnosis?

A patient with 32 weeks of gestation had tachycardia and a blood pressure of 160/110 mm of Hg. On examination, she had pedal edema and lab investigations showed proteinuria. Pritchard regimen with magnesium sulphate was started. What is the indication to stop MgSO4?

options.label: A
options.text: Urine output is 60 ml in 4 hours

questions.correct_answer: A. Urine output is 60 ml in 4 hours

questions.text: A G5P4 female comes for her routine scan. She is already a mother of 4 girl children and wants a boy this time. She is now interested to know the sex of the current child. According to PCPNDT act, what should you do as a radiologist?

options.label: A
options.text: Check for congenital anomalies of the fetus but not look for the sex

options.label: B
options.text: Check for congenital anomalies, the sex of the child and tell her if it is a female child

options.label: C
options.text: Check for congenital anomalies, the sex of the child and do not tell her

options.label: D
options.text: Only check routine ANC and do not do USG

questions.correct_answer: A. Check for congenital anomalies of the fetus but not look for the sex

questions.text: A P1L1 woman, with a history of uneventful previous delivery, presents with secondary infertility and amenorrhea for 2 years. The laparoscopy performed is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old female came with complaints of spotting and foul-smelling discharge. On per speculum examination, cervical erosions were present. Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation required?

options.label: A
options.text: Liquid based cytology, Cervical biospy, HPV antigen testing

options.label: B
options.text: Pap smear, Cervical biopsy, HCV testing

options.label: C
options.text: Pap smear, Cervical biopsy, HBV DNA

questions.correct_answer: A. Liquid based cytology, Cervical biospy, HPV antigen testing

questions.text: A P1L1 woman had delivered a baby 8 hrs before by vaginal delivery. What is the earliest time to insert an IUCD? IUCD-Intra uterine contraceptive device
A pregnant woman presents with a history suggestive of hyperthyroidism at 8 weeks of POG. What is the drug of choice?

In the absence of other obstetric complications in twin pregnancies A and B. What is the preferred mode of delivery for A and B respectively? Image A: 1st twin in breech and 2nd twin in transverse Image B: Both twins in cephalic
questions.correct_answer: B. A. LSCS B. Vaginal delivery

questions.text: A G3P2 patient with preeclampsia develops seizures and is started on the Pritchard regimen. What level of serum magnesium should be maintained in this patient in order to prevent seizures?
A neonate has bilateral chorioretinitis with intraparenchymal calcifications. She also has hydrocephalus. What is the causative organism?
What is represented by each of the following growth curves?

options.label: D
options.text: 1- Brain, 2- Waldeyer’s ring, 3- somatic growth, 4- Testicular growth

questions.correct_answer: D. 1- Brain, 2- Waldeyer’s ring, 3- somatic growth, 4- Testicular growth

questions.text: A mother brought her 2-year-old child to the OPD with complaints of lack of weight gain, abdominal pain on eating, and poor eating habits. The child was advised gluten-free diet after which there was improvement in the general condition and weight gain. What is the probable diagnosis?
A man presents with mixed infection of Plasmodium vivax and Plasmodium falciparum in a health centre in Rajasthan. What is the dosage of the treatment given on the second day?

options.label: A
options.text: 4 tablets of Artesunate 50mg + 6 tablets of Primaquine 2.5mg

options.label: B
options.text: 4 tablets of Artesunate 50mg + 6 tablets of Primaquine 7.5mg

options.label: C
options.text: 4 tablets of Artesunate 50mg + Sulphadoxine 1500mg + 6 tablets of Primaquine 2.5mg

options.label: D
options.text: 4 tablets of Artesunate 45mg + Sulphadoxine 1500mg + 6 tablets of Primaquine 7.5mg

questions.correct_answer: A. 4 tablets of Artesunate 50mg + 6 tablets of Primaquine 2.5mg

questions.text: Which drug is used to treat multiple myeloma that is known to cause reactivation of Herpes Zoster?

A patient presented with breathing”difficulty and nasal polyposis when he took aspirin for fever. He faced this issue previously too when he took aspirin. Which among the following is not true about this?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no allergic sensitization to aspirin and its metabolites

options.label: C
options.text: Occur on exposure to only aspirin

options.label: D
options.text: Occurs with exposure to other NSAIDs too that block COX 1

questions.correct_answer: C. Occur on exposure to only aspirin

questions.text: A 75-year-old female presented with urinary incontinence. She also has cognition decline and dementia. Which of the following drugs is useful for treating urinary incontinence?

A 7-year-old boy presents with a two-week history of persistent fever, fatigue, and pallor, along with easy bruising and gum bleeding. Examination reveals pallor, petechiae on his legs, hepatosplenomegaly, and generalized lymphadenopathy. Blood tests indicate severe anemia, thrombocytopenia, and an elevated white blood cell count with blast cells. What is the best initial treatment for this patient?
Lignocaine is used in a loading dose for the treatment of arrhythmias. The loading dose of this drug depends upon which of the following factors?
A hypertensive patient with chronic kidney disease was having frequent attacks of renal colic. Which of the following diuretics is used?
Identify the drug marked as ‘X’ in the image.

Which of the following beta-adrenergic blockers are beneficial for patients with reduced ejection fraction and can reduce mortality in chronic heart failure without causing exacerbations over a few years?
Which drug is used for maintenance therapy in opium addiction?
A patient who recently underwent surgery has complaints of nausea and vomiting. He was prescribed a drug called aprepitant. What is its mechanism of action?
What are the effects of posterior lesions in a Brodmann’s area 22 in a stroke patient?

A 30-year-old female went on vacation and fell asleep while sitting on a beach. After some time she woke with sunburn. Later when she went back home, she experienced pain while taking a warm bath (40°C). Which of the following receptors is responsible for the pain?
To prevent polyspermy, which reaction occurs in the zona pellucida of the oocyte after fertilization?

options.label: B
options.text: Increased membrane potential of the oocyte

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased membrane potential of the oocyte

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient came with a puncture wound on the left chest wall. Radiological investigations confirmed pneumothorax. Which of the following is correct regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Lung volume increases, thoracic volume increases

options.label: B
options.text: Lung volume decreases, thoracic volume increases

options.label: C
options.text: Lung volume increases, thoracic volume decreases

options.label: D
options.text: Lung volume decreases, thoracic volume decreases

questions.correct_answer: B. Lung volume decreases, thoracic volume increases

questions.text: Sour taste is mediated by which of the following receptors?
A patient who underwent right limb amputation 2 years back, now presents with severe pain in the limb (Phantom limb pain). On radiological investigations, What is the finding seen?

options.label: A
options.text: Projection of adjacent fibres to overlap the right somatosensory cortex

options.label: C
options.text: Projection of adjacent fibres to overlap the left somatosensory cortex

questions.correct_answer: C. Projection of adjacent fibres to overlap the left somatosensory cortex

questions.text: In a type 2 diabetes mellitus patient, serum insulin levels are found to be raised. He is advised to exercise to improve insulin resistance. Which of the following GLUT will help to improve insulin resistance after exercise?
Which of the following is incorrect about iron absorption?

options.label: B
options.text: RBC protophyrin is increased in deficiency

options.label: C
options.text: Iron excretion is only through skin, gut and urothelial cells

options.label: D
options.text: Body cannot compensate if more than 10 RBC/HPF per day is lost in urine

questions.correct_answer: A. Ferrireductase convert Fe2+ to Fe 3+

questions.text: A 50-year-old patient presents with a chronic tingling sensation in the forearm. A neurological examination is done and appears to be normal. Which of the following receptors are correctly matched?
Identify the image representing the National Leprosy eradication program:
What is calculated with the following information?

Every pregnant woman receives a free antenatal check-up on the 9th of each month, along with free medicines and delivery services, including cesarean sections, under the JSSK program. What does JSSK stand for?
What is the communication barrier if interpretation of words are understood in a different manner?
30 young volunteers with previous lifestyle modifications were contributing to drug trial for cholesterol levels based on statin therapy for 9 months. Which of the following tests is performed?

A case-control study is conducted on the association between intake of Vitamin C and the occurrence of respiratory illness. What is the order in which the following steps are conducted? 1 – Measurement of exposure 2- Matching 3-Selecting case and control groups 4- Analysis
Which among the following diseases will be the best representation of the submerged portion?
What does line B represent in the graph given?
In a sudden onset disaster, the ‘recovery’ phase consists of which of the following? i) Preparedness ii) Response iii) Rehabilitation iv) Mitigation
A pharmacist randomly selects from three groups of medicines: plant-based, animal-derived, and synthetic. What type of sampling is this?
The children in a school underwent a health check-up whose ages were 2,3,4,4,5,6,7,8. What is their median age?
Identify the use of this image
A student was making a presentation with charts but lost titles while editing. What could be the heading for the following chart?

A mother delivers a baby in a rural area with the assistance of a skilled birth attendant. The attendant cuts the umbilical cord cleanly, ties the ends with new threads, bathes the baby with warm water, wipes the baby’s eyes with a sterile wet cloth from the medial to lateral corner, and then hands the baby to the mother for skin-to-skin contact. Which of these steps is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Using new threads to tie the ends of the umbilical cord

options.label: B
options.text: Wiping the baby’s eyes from medial to lateral corner

options.label: D
options.text: Bathing the child with warm water

questions.correct_answer: D. Bathing the child with warm water

questions.text: A patient comes with complaints of difficulty falling asleep. He consumes black coffee one hour before bed. Which of the following is the role of caffeine in the wakefulness?

options.label: A
options.text: Caffeine has no effect, and he can continue taking black coffee

options.label: B
options.text: Caffeine causes release of chemical from locus coeruleus that causes awakening

options.label: C
options.text: Caffeine has histaminic action in brain that leads to awakening

options.label: D
options.text: Caffeine inhibits adenosine receptors, thus leading to awakening

questions.correct_answer: D. Caffeine inhibits adenosine receptors, thus leading to awakening

questions.text: Which of the following SNRI is used in the treatment of ADHD?

A 45-year-old woman presents with a feeling of nervousness and has abdominal pain and diarrhoea. She has had a history of heartburn, and indigestion for the past 25 years. She gives similar complaints in the family of being “tense and nervous”. What other symptoms might you expect to see in this condition?

An elderly patient who is a known case of scleroderma presented with shortness of breath. On examination, her right ventricular pressure was 70-80 mmHg and later on catheterization, pulmonary capillary wedge pressure was found to be 35 mmHg. Which of the following is true regarding her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Calcium channel blockers given for all the patients

options.label: B
options.text: Lung transplant is the best treatment, if identified early

options.label: D
options.text: Lifestyle modification is the only possible approach

questions.correct_answer: C. Endothelin receptor antagonists improves symptoms

questions.text: A 26-year-old patient with bronchial asthma who has two episodes in the daytime and one episode at night time per week is prescribed albuterol to use as and when required. MDI FEV1 improved from 76% to 83% after taking bronchodilator. What is the further treatment plan?

options.label: D
options.text: Change to salbutamol MDI twice daily

questions.correct_answer: C. Add fluticasone propionate 40 mg BD

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient came with chest pain shortness of breath, and pedal edema. JVP showed rapid y descent. On auscultation, he had high high-pitched diastolic sound. What is the diagnosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Bicuspid aortic valve with Aortic regurgitation

questions.text: A 30-year-old female patient comes to the outpatient department with complaints of neck swelling. She gives a history of weight loss and palpitations. On examination, she has exophthalmos and a diffusely enlarged thyroid gland. Which of the following is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Severe disease can cause vision loss.

options.label: B
options.text: NO SPECS criteria is used for this condition

options.label: C
options.text: 10% of isolated cases present without hyperthyroidism

options.label: D
options.text: Condition will improve simultaneously with improvement in thyrotoxic state

questions.correct_answer: D. Condition will improve simultaneously with improvement in thyrotoxic state

questions.text: A 56-year-old presented with fever chills & cough with sputum. Blood pressure was measured to be 150/88mmhg, pulse rate 110bpm and respiratory rate-18, spo2-88% at room air. An X-ray was done and shown below. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 45-year-old man presented with fatigue and hemoptysis. His current hemoglobin is 8g/dL (previous hemoglobin one week ago was 12g/dL). His bronchoalveolar lavage is reddish and his serum creatinine was 1.7mg/dL. He is diagnosed with ANCA-positive glomerulonephritis. Biopsy of the kidney revealed pauci-immune deposits and the absence of granulomas. Which of the following conditions is he likely suffering from?

A patient with an acute exacerbation of COPD required mechanical ventilation and experienced a consistent drop in oxygen saturation. Auscultation revealed vesicular breath sounds on the right side. Based on the chest radiography findings, what would you expect to hear on auscultation of the left side?

A patient with salicylic acid poisoning has the following arterial blood gas analysis report: pH = 7.3, pCO2=16mmHg, HCO3—6.3mmol/L, Na+-135, K+- 4.5 CI-113.7, lactate was normal. Which of the following options correctly describes the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Metabolic acidosis with partial compensated respiratory alkolosis with high anion gap

options.label: B
options.text: Respiratory acidosis with compensatory metabolic alkalosis

options.label: C
options.text: Metabolic acidosis with uncompensated respiratory alkalosis

questions.correct_answer: A. Metabolic acidosis with partial compensated respiratory alkolosis with high anion gap

questions.text: Match the following ECG waves with condition: atrial flutter, atrial fibrillation, SVT, ventricular tachycardia

A 34-year-old patient presents with lethargy and tiredness. On examination, he has perioral hyperpigmentation. His blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg and his heart rate is 110 beats/minute. Laboratory investigations revealed Na+ of 125mEq/L and K+ of 5.5mEq/L. What is the most appropriate treatment given to this patient?
A young woman comes with weight loss, tachycardia, heat intolerance, and tremors. She has exophthalmos on examination. What is the diagnosis?
For MDR-RR TB, what is the indication of short course bedaquiline?

options.label: A
options.text: Resistance to rifampicin and sensitive to fluroquinolones

options.label: B
options.text: Mutation only to INH A and kat G gene

questions.correct_answer: A. Resistance to rifampicin and sensitive to fluroquinolones

questions.text: In a patient with type 1 diabetes with 3rd stage beta cell damage, which of the following situations is associated with the same?

An alcoholic patient presented to the emergency in an unconscious state. Relatives stated that he had a similar episode of binge drinking one week back. On examination, his glucose was 49mg/dl. What is the appropriate management?

options.label: A
options.text: IV thiamine followed by dextrose infusion

options.label: B
options.text: Injection vitamin K followed by dextrose infusion

questions.correct_answer: A. IV thiamine followed by dextrose infusion

questions.text: A patient came to the emergency department with dyspnea and palpitations. He is a known case of chronic kidney disease, ECG of the patient is given below. What is the diagnosis?

A 50-year-old female presented with dyspnea and angina episodes. On workup, she is found to have aortic stenosis. Which of the following findings favor the diagnosis of aortic stenosis over aortic regurgitation?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in preload causes more reduction in myocardial oxygen demand than increase in afterload

options.label: B
options.text: Workload has nothing to do with myocardial 02 consumption

options.label: C
options.text: Aortic stenosis causes reduced pressure than aortic valve

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in myocardial 02 consumption is seen with increased pressure work than volume

questions.correct_answer: D. Increase in myocardial 02 consumption is seen with increased pressure work than volume

questions.text: A patient presented with fatigue and tingling sensation in the arms, weight loss and h/o polyuria. The following findings were detected on bone marrow biopsy. What is probable cause?

options.label: A
options.text: Subacute combined degeneration due to cobalamin deficiency

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient presents with dyspnea and chest pain. The pleural fluid analysis shows pleural protein/ serum protein > 0.5, and pleural LDH/ serum LDH > 0.4. What is the diagnosis?

An adolescent presented with fever, purpura on the thigh, swelling of the right knee and left ankle, and abnormal "Mid" diastolic murmur in the cardiac apical area. He was seronegative for rheumatoid factor. What is the probable diagnosis?

A patient came with complaints of easy fatiguability, anaemia, hyperpigmentation of knuckles, oral mucosa, palm and hands, and tachycardia. The blood pressure of the patient is 80/60 mm Hg and Na+ 130mmHg. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A female presents with choreo-athetoid movements, dysarthria, and dystonia with the given finding. Which of the following is the best investigation to confirm the same?

A 27-year-old footballer collapsed on the field and could not be revived. An autopsy was conducted and on cardiac biopsy, the left ventricle was hypertrophied. Identify the possible cause for the same.
A male presented with discharge as shown in the image. What is the diagnosis?

A man presented to the emergency department after RTA with complaints of chest pain and breathing difficulty. An X-ray was done and is given below. What type of breathing pattern is observed in this patient?

A mother brought her 3-month-old male child to the hospital, who is currently unable to pass urine. A similar issue was reported 15 days ago. The catheter could be passed without difficulty. The image of the micturating cystourethrogram is given below. What is the most appropriate management for this condition?
What is the condition seen here?
The baby was born with this deformity. What is the earliest age to correct this defect?

A patient with a history of tuberculosis presents with dysuria and sterile pyuria. The cystoscopy image of the patient is provided below. Based on the patient’s history and the cystoscopic findings, which of the following conditions is most likely associated?
What instrument is required for the following procedure?

A patient with a history of umbilical swelling. Initially asymptomatic for many years, now complains of pain over the swelling. The swelling was reducible initially but is now non-reducible. What is the appropriate management?
A baby was brought In with complaints of intermittent faeculent discharge from the umbilicus. What is the likely diagnosis?

A patient presents with renal colic and recurrent urinary tract infections. A CT scan reveals no significant findings. The patient undergoes a percutaneous nephrolithotomy and his urine analysis is as shown. Based on the clinical presentation and the urine analysis findings, what are these crystals made up of?
What is the treatment plan for this condition?

A patient with oral cancer underwent radical surgery and PMMC flap reconstruction as shown. What is the most important indicator for considering adjuvant radiotherapy in this patient? (PMMC flap Pectoralis Major Myocutaneous flap)
Identify the stage of bed sore in the sacral region.
Based on the constituents, identify the fluid given to post-operative patients.
A female patient presented with a breast mass, as shown in the image below, with concomitant liver metastasis. What is the recommended management. Plan for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Neo adjuvant chemotherapy followed by surgery

questions.text: An elderly male who presented with the following lesion as shown, is diagnosed with stage T3 carcinoma with no clinically palpable inguinal lymph nodes. What is the management strategy for this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Penectomy + Superficial inguinal lymph node dissection

questions.correct_answer: D. Penectomy + Superficial inguinal lymph node dissection

questions.text: The most commonly occurring complication of TPN in a sepsis patient in ICU:
A CT scan of a patient with a hydatid cyst is shown below. What is the type of hydatid cyst as per the Gharbi classification? CT-Computed Tomography
If a tumor compresses the structures passing through the opening marked in the given image, which of the following sensations would be affected?

options.label: C
options.text: Sensation in the anterior scalp and dorsum of the nose

questions.correct_answer: C. Sensation in the anterior scalp and dorsum of the nose

questions.text: An absent gag reflex can result from injury to which of the following nerves?

A chronic tobacco consumer went to the dental clinic with bleeding lesions on his tongue and was diagnosed with carcinoma of the tongue. Which of the following papillae, which do not have taste buds, is least likely to be involved in such a cancer?
What is the outer covering of the condition shown in the image?
Which artery is used for arteriovenous shunting with the great saphenous vein for hemodialysis, and is located behind the medial malleolus and 2.5 cm in front of the tendocalcaneus?

A child presents with orangish hue skin with rough and scaly skin as shown in the image. On histopathological examination, orthokeratosis and parakeratosis are seen. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presented with a slight loss of sensation along the ulnar nerve and a solitary nodule in the forearm. Intradermal antigen was injected. The histopathology image is shown below. Which of the following is true regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Lepromatous leprosy with dermal test positive

options.label: B
options.text: Tuberculoid leprosy with dermal test positive

options.label: C
options.text: Lepromatous leprosy with dermal test negative

options.label: D
options.text: Erythema nodosum leprosum with negative skin test

questions.correct_answer: B. Tuberculoid leprosy with dermal test positive

questions.text: Which of the following is associated with the” box sign”?
A 32-year-old man presents with painful vesicular lesions over the genital area. He has a history of multiple sexual partners and inconsistent condom use. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Match the structures shown in the image:

options.label: A
options.text: A- Apocrine sweat gland; B- Eccrine sweat gland, C- Sebaceous gland, D- Erector pili muscle

options.label: B
options.text: A- Eccrine sweat gland; B- Apocrine sweat gland; C- Sebaceous gland, D- Erector pili muscle

options.label: C
options.text: A- Sebaceous gland, B- Apocrine sweat gland, C- Eccrine sweat gland: D- Erector pili muscle

options.label: D
options.text: A- Eccrine sweat gland; B- Sebaceous gland; C- Apocrine sweat gland; D- Erector pili muscle

questions.correct_answer: B. A- Eccrine sweat gland; B- Apocrine sweat gland; C- Sebaceous gland, D- Erector pili muscle

questions.text: An adult male presented with asymptomatic macules over the chest, moist grey, perianal lesions, and findings on the scalp as shown. What is the most likely causative organism of this condition?
Which of the following muscle is responsible for ptosis in horner’s syndrome?
An 11-year-old presented with the following growth in the eye as shown below. What is the diagnosis?
Patient undergoes lens implantation folllowing which there’s worsening of vision after 1 year. Slit lamp examination finding is shown in the image below. Identify the complication.
Identify the perimetry finding.
A patient undergoes worth's four-dot test. The results are as shown in the image below. Identify the condition.
A 20-year-old presented with gradual loss of vision at night and a fundoscopy image is shown. What is the diagnosis?
A patient met with road traffic accident and complained of severe back ache. The X-ray is shown below. What fracture does the patient have?

An 18-year-old boy complains of fever and pain in the lower limb. There is a localised rise of temperature and tenderness in the region shown in the radiograph. ESR is raised. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A child sustained an injury as shown in the below radiograph. What is the classification used and the grade used for this type of injury?
A patient sustained a fracture of the base of the fifth metatarsal in the right foot. He was advised below knee pop cast. How long should the cast be put?
Following a road traffic accident, a patient with an intertrochanteric fracture of the femur was treated with the implant shown below. Identify the implant.

A young woman, following an intense workout involving heavy weight lifting, presents with lower back pain radiating to her right hip and extending down to her right ankle. MRI shows the following finding. Based on the location and radiation of her pain, which of the following nerve roots is most likely involved?

A child with rickets not responding to treatment is being evaluated. Investigations show a serum calcium level of 9 mg/dL, low phosphate level of 2 mg/dL, elevated alkaline phosphatase, and normal parathyroid hormone levels with normal arterial blood gas levels. What is the diagnosis?
What is this type of amputation called?
Which condition is inherited according to the given pedigree?
Which of the following is not true about vWD?

options.label: A
options.text: VWD type 3 has severely low levels of VWF

options.label: B
options.text: VWD type 1 is the most severe disease in children

options.label: C
options.text: VWD type 3 is the most severe disease in children

options.label: D
options.text: VWD type 2 is associated with moderate bleeding tendency

questions.correct_answer: B. VWD type 1 is the most severe disease in children

questions.text: A patient with COPD presented with ARDS symptoms. What is the role of IL-8 in inflammation?
A patient presented with abdominal pain, hepatosplenomegaly and WBC count >50,000/mm3. Which of the following genes is involved in this case?
A 55-year-old chronic smoker presents with weight loss, hemoptysis and TTF-1 positivity. What is the possible diagnosis?

A patient presents with flank pain and hematuria. The histology slide of the patient is provided. Based on the clinical presentation and histological findings, which of the following conditions is most likely?

A patient came to the OPD with complaints of vomiting and diarrhoea along with skin eruptions. He gives the history of similar episodes in the past. After switching to gluten free diet his symptoms resolved. Which marker is useful in diagnosing this condition?
Which of the following processes is mediated by CRISPR CAS-9 technology?
Which of the following agents is appropriate for reversing vecuronium when renal function tests are normal?
A COPD patient with a history of smoking presents with respiratory symptoms. High resolution CT showed panacinar emphysema. Which enzyme deficiency is associated with this condition?
A 34-year-old female presented with low Hb, platelet count of 25000/mm3, raised PT and aPTT. A peripheral smear is given. Which of the following fusion genes is affected?
A 12-year-old child comes with cervical lymphadenopathy. Lymph node biopsy shows CD 10 +, CD 19+, CD 20+, CD 5, CD 23-, and Tdt negative. What is the diagnosis?
Identify the disease with the chromosomal abnormality?

A 49-year-old patient comes with complaints of left flank pain, hematuria, weight loss, headache, nausea, and convulsions. A family history of brain tumours and kidney tumours is present. MRI showed a cerebellar mass. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following is most common mutation associated with the microscopy image of the thyroid shown?
Which of the following stain can be used for laryngeal mass seen during laryngoscopic examination?
An 18-year-old male presents to the emergency department with epistaxis and a nasal mass. What is the investigation of choice to evaluate his condition?

A female patient presents with nausea, vomiting, and a sensation of objects moving around her. She is diagnosed with left vestibular neuritis. Her head impulse test is positive. What is the correct finding?

options.label: A
options.text: Right saccade with right side movement

options.label: B
options.text: Left saccade with right side movement

options.label: C
options.text: Right saccade with left side movement

options.label: D
options.text: Left saccade with left side movement

questions.correct_answer: C. Right saccade with left side movement

questions.text: Match the following with the nerve supply of external ear.

options.label: A
options.text: Auriculotemporal nerve; B – Greater auricular nerve; C-Facial and Vagus nerve

options.label: B
options.text: A-Greater auricular nerve; B- Auriculotemporal nerve; C-Facial and Vagus nerve

options.label: C
options.text: A-Greater auricular nerve; B – Facial and Vagus nerve; C-Auriculotemporal nerve

options.label: D
options.text: A-Facial and Vagus nerve; B – Greater auricular nerve; C-Auriculotemporal nerve

questions.correct_answer: A. Auriculotemporal nerve; B – Greater auricular nerve; C-Facial and Vagus nerve

questions.text: A female singer presents with hoarseness of voice and difficulty singing in a high pitch. On laryngoscopy, it was noted that one vocal cord is bowed, positioned lower than the other, and the associated muscle is shortened. Which muscle is likely affected in this scenario?
What is the marked structure of the cochlear implant shown below?

A patient presented with nasal congestion and upon examination, nasal polyps were observed. A coronal CT scan of the patient was taken and is as shown below. Which of the following sinus drainage pathways is likely to be affected? CT-Computed Tomography
During the post mortem examination following finding is seen. What is this indicative of
An 18-year-old boy was brought by police, and accused of sexual assault, but the boy claims to be a minor (16 years old). Which radiographs will you order to solve this discrepancy?
A man sexually aroused when he wears his female partner’s dress and heels. He denies getting attracted to male. What is this condition called?
A woman gave birth to a child 8 months after the death of her husband. The in-laws claim that the child is not their son, however, the DNA testing confirms the paternity. The child is known as
The railway police has bought a person with suspected poisoning. On examination, he was confused with slurred speech, hot skin, dry mouth, dilated pupils. What is the probable poisoning?

A police officer brought a child to the hospital. There is redness and tenderness around perianal region. A rectal swab is taken and the image given below is the finding. What test is it indicative of?
Rigor mortis is well established in 12-24 hours after death. What is the order of appearance of rigor mortis?
A 5-year-old child has consumed overdose of iron syrup, around 60mg/kg. Which among the following is contraindicated?
A sexual assault survivor had to testify in court and an in-camera trial was conducted. What is an “in-camera” trial?

options.label: D
options.text: Proceeding held in a different location

questions.text: Which of the following is used for syndromic diagnosis of infected cases like meningitis?
A patient receiving chemotherapy develops pneumonia with skin lesions. Microscopy of specimen from skin lesions showed broad based budding with a thick capsule. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old man came to the OPD with a febrile illness of 2 days, associated with abdominal tenderness, malaise and diarrhoea. He had a fever with bradycardia and BP was noted as 110/70 mmHg. He lives in a crowded neighborhood with poor sanitation where many others have reported similar complaints recently. Which of the following investigations would be the most appropriate choice for this patient?

A child presents with abdominal pain, diarrhea, and perianal itching for the past 3 days. The mother found a white thread-like structure in the child's night clothes and brought the worm to the clinician. A perianal swab was collected, and microscopy of the swab and the worm is shown in the images. What is the likely causative organism?
A male patient comes to you with a history of UTI, the cause of which is suspected to be bacteria. Which of the following is used by the bacteria for adherence?
A thalassemia patient has received multiple blood transfusions. Aplastic crisis can occur in this patient due to infection from?

A 45-year-old farmer comes with complaints of high-grade fever with chills, retro-orbital pain and conjunctival suffusion. On examination, he has severe calf tenderness. Lab examination shows hypokalemia and neutropenia. What is the likely diagnosis?

A patient with a history of consumption of oysters comes with complaints of nausea, vomiting and crampy abdominal pain. The culture of the organism showed the Kanagawa phenomenon. What is the causative organism?

A man is having petechial rashes with a previous history of meningitis. He was vaccinated at the age of 5 years. Now, Brudzinski and Kernig’s signs were positive. Microscopy showed gram negative diplococci. What is the likely causative organism?

A patient with a central line on long-term IV antibiotics develops a fever. Blood cultures reveal Staphylococcus epidermidis and biofilm formation. Which statement about its antibiotic resistance is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Biofilm provides resistance, necessitating catheter removal

options.label: C
options.text: Biofilm does not affect antibiotic susceptibility

options.label: D
options.text: Biofilm can be removed from the catheter

questions.correct_answer: B. Biofilm provides resistance, necessitating catheter removal

questions.text: Laboratory investigations in a patient with desert rheumatism showed dimorphic and thermal fungi with arthrospores. What is the causative organism of desert rheumatism?
A farmer from South East India presents with fever, respiratory distress and neurological deficits. The vector of the causative organism is shown below. What is the associated organism?

A 21-year-old female presents with fever, headache, and vomiting for the past 3 days. She has been living in an army recruitment camp for three weeks. Examination reveals neck stiffness and a maculopapular rash on her trunk and extremities. Which statement about her likely disease is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Carriers can be treated with Rifampicin

options.label: C
options.text: Terminal complement deficiency increases the risk

options.label: D
options.text: Metronidazole is the drug of choice

questions.correct_answer: D. Metronidazole is the drug of choice

questions.text: A young sexually active female presented with a symptomatic UTI, and urinalysis and cultures revealed novobiocin-resistant coagulase-negative staphylococcus at a count of 10 4 cells/HPF. Which statement is true regarding this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: The test must be repeated with a fresh specimen

options.label: C
options.text: Diagnose and treat as a urinary tract infection

options.label: D
options.text: Normal skin commensal grown on culture that needs to be proven

questions.correct_answer: C. Diagnose and treat as a urinary tract infection

questions.text: A 28-year-old truck driver presents with painful multiple ulcers on his penis 3 days after unprotected sexual intercourse. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presented with chest pain and hoarseness for one month, and on a CT angiogram, the following image is seen, what is the possible diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: C. Saccular aneurysm of distal aorta

questions.text: This is the radiograph of a child with a foreign body in the oesophagus. What is the sign seen in this?

A patient presents with a one-month history of lethargy, headache, fever, and vomiting. Shortly after being admitted to the hospital, the patient tragically passes away. Radiological imaging reveals multiple cystic lesions in the cerebrum with invasion into the ventricles and subarachnoid space. What is the likely cause?
A patient complains of severe headache. NCCT and CT angiography images are as below. What is the likely etiology?

An elderly woman with a known history of Myasthenia Gravis presents with symptoms including fatigue, facial congestion, dilated neck veins, and breathlessness, which are indicative of superior vena cava (SVC) obstruction. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 4-week-old infant presented to the ER with projectile vomiting. USG abdomen findings of the infant are given below. Probable diagnosis is USG-Ultrasonography
An infant presents with respiratory distress. He has a previous history of recurrent respiratory infections. What is the diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Congenital malformations of the airway

questions.text: A young patient presents with nasal polyps and rhinosinusitis. X-ray and clinical images are as below. What is the diagnosis?
Given below is a USG taken at approximately 8 weeks of gestation. Which anomaly can be observed here? USG-ultrasound
